The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the processing circuitry is further configured to:determine whether a current time is within the effective time of the message;determine whether a position of the electronic apparatus is within the effective range of the message; andforward the message, in a case where the current time is within the effective time of the message and the position of the electronic apparatus is within the effective range of the message.

3. The electronic apparatus according to claim 2, wherein the processing circuitry is further configured to:discard the message, in a case where the current time is not within the effective time of the message or the position of the electronic apparatus is not within the effective range of the message.
4. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the effective time of the message comprises a start time of the message and an end time of the message.
5. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the effective range of the message comprises a position of a message source and an effective radius of the message.

6. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the message further comprises a priority of the message, andwherein the processing circuitry is further configured to: determine, according to the priority of the message, an order of forwarding the message.

7. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the message comprises a basic safety message, a map message, a road side unit message, a road side safety message, a Radio Technical Commission for Maritime services differential signal message or a signal lamp message.
8. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the processing circuitry is further configured to:receive the message from a road side unit, other vehicle or a network side apparatus.

9. The electronic apparatus according to claim 1, wherein the processing circuitry is further configured to:receive the message from a vulnerable road user, the vulnerable road user representing a traffic participant whose transportation means is not a vehicle, the message comprising physiological parameters of the vulnerable road user; anddetermine a driving strategy of the vehicle according to the physiological parameters of the vulnerable road user.

10. An electronic apparatus for a road side unit, comprising processing circuitry configured to:determine an effective time of a message and an effective range of the message;generate the message, wherein the message comprises the effective time of the message and the effective range of the message; andsend the message to a vehicle, for the vehicle to determine, according to the effective time of the message and the effective range of the message, whether to forward the message.
11. The electronic apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the effective time of the message comprises a start time of the message and an end time of the message.
12. The electronic apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the effective range of the message comprises a position of a message source and an effective radius of the message.

13. The electronic apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the processing circuitry is further configured to: determine a priority of the message, the priority representing an order of forwarding the message, wherein the message further comprises the priority of the message.
14. The electronic apparatus according to claim 10, wherein the message comprises: a map message, a road side unit message, a road side safety message or a signal lamp message.
15. (canceled)

16. A wireless communication method performed by an electronic apparatus for a vehicle, comprising:receiving a message comprising an effective time of the message and an effective range of the message; anddetermining, according to the effective time of the message and the effective range of the message, whether to forward the message.

17. The wireless communication method according to claim 16, wherein the determining whether to forward the message comprises:determining whether a current time is within the effective time of the message;determining whether a position of the electronic apparatus is within the effective range of the message; andforwarding the message in a case that the current time is within the effective time of the message and the position of the electronic apparatus is within the effective range of the message.

18. The wireless communication method according to claim 17, wherein the determining whether to forward the message comprises:discarding the message in a case that the current time is not within the effective time of the message or the position of the electronic apparatus is not within the effective range of the message.
19. The wireless communication method according to claim 16, wherein the effective time of the message comprises a start time of the message and an end time of the message.
20. The wireless communication method according to claim 16, wherein the effective range of the message comprises a position of a message source and an effective radius of the message.

21. The wireless communication method according to claim 16, wherein the message further comprises a priority of the message, andwherein the wireless communication method further comprises: determining an order of forwarding the message according to the priority of the message.
22.-31. (canceled)
